text:

We went trail riding yesterday and these youth sized atv’s went everywhere that the adult 1000 cc plus atv’s went. Even 3’ of water.

name: Mike Slaughter
text: This guy is so unprofessional, after me calling him for 2 months trying to get my quad fixed every time I called he’ll tell me to call back at a certain time and day and when I do,he will tell me the exact thing again for 2 months straight,then this last time I called he replied “I’m taking anymore in” and when I asked why he couldn’t just tell me that foo fighters rom the jump instead of dragging me around,when I could’ve been looking elsewhere his reply then was “I don’t know bye and hung up...not to mention my buddy who recommended me to him just took his quad up there last week and got it out within 3 days later but here I am still waiting after 2 months

text: Fixed a problem i had in less than 24 hours

text: best shop in the world if you ask me

text: Great work ethic and ability

name: Leo King
text: Nice shop

name: Keith Warren
text: Not able to help

name: tim parker
text: Good service, but wanna price like a dealership. $75 to patch a rear tire. Ouch!

resp.text: We don't patch tires. And we've been in business for 20 years. And our technicians have more experience than any dealership within 100 miles. We aren't the cheapest but we are the best.

name: Laron Langford
text: I paid 580 and he did nothing suppose to take somewhere else you should know a axle bent before barron have the receipt he didnt have a problem collecting money use another atv repair it was a bad job they did for that much money two weeks turned to month and a half and who dont check axle before baron any key fits in it my kids four wheeler cranks it so anyone could us a key to get bad service

resp.text: I've never worked on this guys unit. Obviously this is a family member of Jamaya Langford. Jamaya paid my for the work we did $580. And declined the axle repair. I SHOULD MENTION FOR POSSIBLE SERVICE DEPARTMENTS.  JAMAYA ARGUED AT EVERY ESTIMATE AND TIME FRAME. Businesses BEWARE!!!

name: Trinnie Faith (Tt)
text: terrible service and very unprofessional. save yourself the headache

resp.text: We have never spoke to you or serviced anything for you. Google once again allows reviews of none customers but expects companies to pay them for advertising. Pretty pathetic to say the least.

name: Cory Dunaway
text: I took my VT600 there for fork seals and said check all spark plugs and replace if needed while it is there. I get it back and noticed they only replaced 2. I called and asked why and was told my bike only has 2 spark plugs. (it has 4) I'm not sure what kind of mechanic can't identify 4 plugs and wires, but they've lost my future business. And the story by the owner about only having 2 in stock was never given to me until this Google review went up. Do better work and you won't get negative reviews. Not everyone wants to bring their bike back twice for something that was simple and should have been done the first time.

resp.text: Customer Brings in Vt 600 for fork seals and spark plugs. We only had 2 spark plugs instock. So we changed the primary plugs so he could enjoy this beautiful fall weather.  We had to order the other 2 plugs.  Customer is unsatified that he has to bring bike back to replace seconday plugs at no charge.  We only charged the customer for the 2 plugs we installed. We apologized for the inconvience.  Google and their reveiws leave me speechless to how easy an unreasonable customer can down grade your rating of your company.  Pretty pathetic GOOGLE!

name: Jamaya Langford
text: Spent 500$ on repairs and still didn’t fix it tore my lights up under the four wheeler up

resp.text: Lights and issues that where fixed where a liability both to the customer and my business.  The lights where rigged and a fire hazard. Mr. Langford ask us to fix a key switch initially that estimate was $240. We fixed the keys switch and then Mr Langford ask us to change the oil and to check to see if the rim was bent. Upon inspection we noticed that the wheel was fine but the bearing carrier was crack and bearings where bad. .  We replaced the cracked bearing carrier and bad bearings $240 parts and labor. Only to find that the axle was bent. When the axle was advised and the estimate of $250 parts and labor was given. Unfortanetly he declined and took the ATV else where.  I SHOULD MENTION FOR POSSIBLE SERVICE DEPARTMENTS.  JAMAYA ARGUED AT EVERY ESTIMATE AND TIME FRAME. Businesses BEWARE!!!

name: Gene Lineberry
text: Did a good job on my busa 👍

name: Micah Cantrell
text: Bought an atv for my daughter today. They answered all my questions. They were very friendly and professional and not condescending at all (I an very ignorant about small engines (or any engine for that matter). They showed me everything I needed to know about simple maintenence and storage and even helped me load it in my truck. I've been to several places today, and they won my business with being knowledgeable, friendly, and they had the best price. I hope to use them in the future for my service needs. Highly recommend.

resp.text: Thank you and Merry Christmas

name: James Shelton
text: Great place for all sxs needs.

resp.text: Thank you

name: Larry Davis
text: Good place and good people

resp.text: Thank you Larry!!

name: Joshua Wagnon
text: Very helpful guys with the best prices!

name: Montavvos Edwards
text: I had a very good experience

resp.text: Thank you Mr. Edwards

name: Joseph
text: These guys installed a clutch kit as well as a couple of other things. Very professional and the turn around time from when we dropped it off to when we picked it up was so fast. We highly recommend and we will bring our RZR back here.

resp.text: Thank you

name: Dustin Robbins
text: 20 years in business and it shows.

name: Jon Stebbins
text: Took a go cart there had a used stator put on for 100 dollars. Talked to the mechanic and guy at the front about putting a new carb on when I went to pick it up, He (mechanic) shows me a new carb tells me 50 for the carb and 50 for labor mind you the other guy was sitting there talking with us about it. So a week later I take it back to get the carb put on and when I go pick it up they charge me 204 dollars. The same guy tells me I must have misunderstood and the labor was 100. So why is it 204 I asked. Well he cleaned out the gas tank also he says. I had already cleaned the gas tank out and replaced all the gas lines and filter before I took it up there. This place is a ripoff. Over priced and will do bs work that you don’t ask for just so they can charge you more.

name: Joseph Morgan
text: Great guys to deal with. Great service and good deals.

name: Apoth3cary
text: I asked to replace front sprocket and they replaced rear. Took over a month for a chain and sprocket. Got the bike back with no gas. High price for barely adequate job.

resp.text: We have your worn out rear sprocket and chain here at our shop for you to come look at. And changing the sprocket does not include a free tank of fuel. Your front sprocket was approved by the technician as ok.  And your bike sat here at the shop 8 days after we called it completed. Safe travels Sir.

name: Gary Whitlock
text: Initially the work was good, quick and a fair price, just called and told them the fuel line they installed split, just told me the size it was, auto parts store said it was a vacuum line, not a fuel line, guess I'll have to figure it out for myself

resp.text:
We supplied the most reasonable solution. Displaying common sense. If you'd liked we could've asked you to spend the same 50 cents to drive to us and we would have given you  a fuel line after we ordered it We where out of stock that day. I assumed it would be just as easy for you to stop at a parts store and grab a fuel line. I do apologize that your 50 cent fuel line spilt we hope you where able to figure it out by your lonesome
.

name: jonathan croley
text: Dustin has always answered any questions I have had and gives honest advice . Best prices you’ll find and he will stand behind his products.

resp.text: Thank you.

name: Jeremy Woodall
text: Best in the business! I've had them work on four wheelers, seadoo and my motorcycle. If you want it fixed and fixed right, bring them whatever you got!

resp.text: Thank you Jeremy.

text:

text: Stopped in on vacation just to buy a shirt. Unfortunately they did not have it in my size. Gentleman say's no worry's if you got a few minutes I'll go make you one. So I got my shirt and some very good conversation while I waited.

text: First class all the way!!! It was a pleasure purchasing a bike from them! Highly recommended!

name: William Robbins
text: This is a consignment shop my experience with these folks is you’re better off just run your own ads and sell it yourself. There are only two reasons something won’t sell, there’s something wrong with the price or something wrong with the item. I repeatedly suggested they drop the price but if they drop the price they realize   a drop in their commission.

text: Do not do business with this company.  I had an agreement drawn up on a motorcycle here and got financed for the amount that was agreed upon and I was told to get.  I spoke with Janice the owners wife and person who does the paperwork and she attempted to change the deal and state that we had not agreed on the earlier deal she told me to get financed for.  Her husband had told me the day before that he was thinking about keeping the motorcycle for himself after the deal had been iniciated.  After this conversation with him is when they started trying to change the details of our agreement.  They are already selling for more than the value of the product and then outright lie to the customers.  If you are ever wanting a motorcycle please steer clear of this company.

text: dropped off some free motorcycle stickers and information from motorcycle lawyer and took off very friendly place very neat and clean

name: Mark Wilkins
text: I needed a fairly unique repair and Russell’s first, was one of the very few shops that would even discuss.  I took it down and they reviewed and gave me an estimate to repair.  After talking through options I was comfortable that they would be fair and do a great job. Picked it up today and the repair is better than expected.  They also came in with a great price.  Highly recommend!

name: Shaun Miller
text: I bought a motorcycle from big one motor sports thinking that I was getting a great deal and that if I had any problems I could bring it to them. Long story short I laid the bike down and took it back to them for repairs. Big one had my bike for ove a month and never called me to keep me informed of what was going on. I then decided I needed to find a new place to get my bike fixed. I found Russell's speed shop on line and took my bike there. If you have a motorcycle you are doing your self a disservice if you don't get you work done at Russell's speed shop. He not only has the greatest customer service i have experienced but he also educates you on what the problem was or might be and how he has or is going to fix it. For me as a person who has only owned a motorcycle for about 4 months that is everything. Taking your motorcycle to Russell's speed shop makes you feel like you have your own personal mechanic.

name: Tommy Dotson
text: Great customer service. Got me in and out for tires, tire change, and balance. Will definitely use them again

name: Ezaldean Kahil
text: This was my very first experience with Russell's Speed Shop. I called them today and asked them what their availability was to install frame sliders on my bike. They told me that today was fine and quoted me a cost. Not only did they get me in the same day, which for most of us who ride bikes knows is almost impossible. They started working on my bike as soon as I got to the shop. They put on the sliders in under the quoted time (they had to remove all the fairings), and also adjusted my pre-load at no additional cost. Keep in mind they still had people walking in the door while they were working and still tended to those customers as well. I thought it was super cool that I could actually see them working on it and loved the layout of the place. I highly recommend them and will most definitely be back.

name: Kris Knight
text: I have had them do a lot of things to my Harley, which Russell admitted he didn't have much experience with, and still have done great work and back it up. My new key ignition they installed isn't working properly and so they took my bike in right away and rigged up something until we can find out about the warranty at no charge. Great guys and very honest about what they can do and what you actually need done. The prices are very competitive as well.

name: B Zoo
text: I've had nothing but outstanding experiences. Everyone there is competent, friendly and knowledgeable. You get VALUE & QUALITY along with EXCELLENT PRICING!  I know I can trust Russell's advice and receive exceptional service. *PW80

resp.text: We value you as a loyal customer

name: Martin Dawson
text: Was coming through Birmingham in the last week of an 11k  miles cross country trip on my Triumph and needed some quick work done to get me confidently through the last 1,500 miles home. The guys were super cool and very accommodating on short notice. I trusted their advice, the price was fair and the quality of work was excellent. I'd recommend to locals and travelers alike.

name: jose huerta
text: Very good and fast to work

name: Ray Gironda
text: Always curtious. Super knowledgable. Fair labor rates.

name: Eli Sumner
text: Dropped my 1979 Honda CX500c off with Russell back in February and just got it back 5 weeks later. Could not be more pleased with how everything turned out. Russell called and updated me several times on what they were doing to the bike and what needed to be done. Everything was done in a timely manner and very reasonably priced. I would highly recommend them.

name: Miguel Dãniel Louiś
text: It was in 2016 i was on my 85 day motorcycle trip when i stopped by needing some basic help, which russell was more than happy to help me with. I got my oil changed and disposed of in timely fashion and was able to continue on my way. A real old school biker that offers riders genuine help.

name: Martin Dortch
text: Definitely wouldn’t recommend this place. Shop doesn’t have all the necessary technology to get the job done. They were working on my bike knowing they didn’t have what they needed for it just to run up a quick tab. Still didn’t know anything about my bike once I got it back from them. I called to see about my bike & the owner got mad, hung up in my face after telling me my bike will be outside. Not professional at all. Owner & worker seems like they’re always on drugs. Shop located in a horrible location. Crackheads everywhere

text: Went in to get new tires on a classic cruiser. They got me what I needed and gave me a great price I will definitely be coming back for future bike needs.

name: Justin Horn
text:
Russell was extremely helpful when it came to repairing my bike.  He gladly answered any questions I had and even offered suggestions for future maintenance.  The labor rate was fair, my bike was returned to me clean, and they were also very quick with service.

I highly recommend Russell's Speed Shop to anyone looking for a solid motorcycle shop.

name: Scott Padgitt
text:
Great guys!
Know their stuff and have been in business for a long time. I recommend them often.

name: oneonfire
text: When in for an oil change on a 2015 turbo busa didn't take long at all even with me driving there . Good price. Even tightened a hose that had a small leak and tightened my air filter for the turbo. I fully recommend going here.

name: Todd Cheney
text: Needed tires replaced on Suzuki Burgman 650.  Russell and Terry did a remarkable job.  Got me in and out in no time.  Will go back.  Highly recommend!

name: Dana Ashmore
text: Hands down best shop in Birmingham. I highly recommend because of the awesome experience I had. Fast labor unbeatable prices and really put customers interest first. Thank you guys for everything you do.

name: Kevin Laux
text: Fortunate to have found Russell and his Speed Shop.  Good prices, great service, genuinely good dude!  Highly recommend!

name: Chet VanAken
text: I had a flat north of town by Steele and Russell came an picked me up and took me to get a tire that fit as well as changing it out.  This was a big deal and really helped me out.  He specializes in sport bikes but if you need something they are willing and able to help.

name: Don Hendricks
text: Took my Triumph to Russell's for carb work recently. In comparison to the franchise chain dealer where I had similar work done on a different bike, Russell's work was more thorough, much quicker and much less expensive! I really appreciated that they took care of other problems they saw but weren't related to the carb issue too. I would recommend Russell's to anyone who asked, it is hard to find that kind of service these days!  THANKS and A+++++

name: sal mez
text: Bought my daytona 600 to them to replace the rear tire. Was in and out within 30 minutes. also fixed an issue that was not related to the tires. Great guys, very professional.

name: Jesse Phillips
text: Picked up my bike beside the road after I popped the clutch cable, and were fair, honest and helpful throughout the repair.  Top notch place, recommended.

name: Clifford Spruill
text: I was riding from Kansas City and caught a flat in my rear tire on I65 coming through town. Was worried about finding a good place in a town I'm not from. Russell's Speed Shop got me up and running again right then and for as good of a price as I get my from my guy back home. Nice to find fair helpful people when you are need. If you got a bike that needs some work in Birmingham Russell's is the place to go.

name: Austin Brunson
text: This is a great shop, Russell is knowledgeable and fair. Finally found a shop worth going to (over an hour drive for me).

name: Rucker Staggers
text: Bought my first bike and took it to them to get checked out. Other shops wanted around $150 just to check out the fluids and make sure it's safe which is outrageous. Russell gave me an extremely fair price and took the time to show me around the bike, even though they were jammed back with work. Just goes to show how many people trust these guys with their bikes. They are always friendly and down to earth. Honest and want their customers to be happy.

name: Santrell Howard
text: Pulled up told me my problem fixed it with no problem  Thanks Russ

text: Gone there a couple of times now. Reasonable to mount tires and good pricing too. Helped me with a dyno and some tips to make jetting changes. (it's a pain to make changes on my hike as it's a prototype jet kit / carb setup) good people and awesome. Shop dogs.

name: Paul McKee
text: Good people. Quality work. Honest prices.

name: Laura Beth Mitchell
text: Russell was able to identify and fix a problem i was having with my electric scooter and make recommendations for the future within an hour. They went above and beyond!

name: Bryan Allen
text:
Had a very unfortunate mishap on the highway,  they were VERY prompt at coming to pick me and my bike up to service.  They tried to fix and get me going right on the side of the road, unfortunately could not.  Was told I’d get a call in a couple days to let me know about parts and labor,  2 days came and went.
Fast Forward to $685 later as I rode off on my (3 month old)2017 Honda CBR1000RR.  Several service engine lights came on....Was asked to bring the bike back.   Was a bit skeptical taking it back to that particular shop.
I never did go back or call....however,  seems to me if I ever wanted to repeat business in the future,  perform at LEAST a courtesy call...just to see if everything was ok.

Although I did receive “some” professional courtesy,  I probably won’t be returning....spend a little more money “maybe”. Take your bike to your dealer.

The quote also included additonal items and work not included. Such a great value and was referred to me by word of mouth.

text: If you are looking for a dependable and knowledgeable mechanic for your bike then look no further. Ernie is top notch and exactly what I was looking for in a local shop. I had 2 new tires mounted and balanced and a 3 hole oil change done and my 03 Heritage rode better when I picked it up than when I dropped it off. Stop messing around with other shops and give Stone's a chance, you won't regret it!! Will be back for sure. Thanks again!

name: Web Richburg
text: Ernie does rock solid work. His price for labor is very fair for the quality of work done. He works in a timely manner and gets it right the first time. I’ve already recommended him to a friend and I, myself, will definitely be coming back to Ernie next time I need anything done on my bike.

name: EANGUS Junior Enlisted
text: Stone is absolutely amazing. His professionalism and expertise is a dying art in today’s culture. He kept me well informed and up to date on the status of my bike, provided excellent service and even provided A+ Southern Hospitality when he did not have to. He is straight to the point and will not try to jerk you around. I have a personal high respect for Stone and will only use him for my bike needs.

name: Ken Seanard
text: Dropped my 07 Yamaha at Stone’s and drove home on a new bike! Ernie replaced my tires and tuned-up my bike to factory specs, it runs better than I knew! Professional and personable, I’ve found the mechanic that most everyone is looking for. Give Stone’s a call if you need your bike properly repaired, he will not let unsafe out the door! Thanks for squeezing me in, Ernie!

name: Sam Eder
text: Ernie is a great guy and was able to get my rim and tire mounted quickly. He is a good guy to be around and was able to get me back on the road quickly. I wouldn't hesitate to come back.

name: andre parson
text: Called around trying to find a shop that I could get some service don’t to my motorcycle and found stones. He was working on renovating his building but fit me into his tight schedule. Great service from a fellow motorcycle enthusiast who has a love for his work. He kept me informed on the progress of his work and had me in and out in no time! Thanks to stone my Zx-10  Is back on the road. Would definitely recommend.

name: Charlie Palandati
text: Bike wouldn’t start and took it to Stones. Ernie diagnosed the problem and gave me a fair price for the work. Will come back again for any future issues.

He is fair, honest, and a pleasure to talk to.  He has worked on my Harley as well in the past with great results.  I will be taking my bike to him anytime it needs work!

text: When you take a motorcycle to a repair shop you are looking for someone with experience and someone you can trust. At the same time someone that is fair and doesn’t want to take all your money. This place has everything mentioned above. I will take my motorcycle to stone every time. Thank you for your help with my motorcycle !

name: Amanda G
text: Great accurate and friendly service!

text: Glad I found this shop, Ernie is a great guy to do business with!  Great service at a fair price.  I’ll continue to trust him with all my motorcycle needs.

I would recommend you bring your bike to him next time you have an issue, I dont see why you would go anywhere else. He brought my old bike back to life and I havent seen it run this well since I've owned it. Highly recommend Stone's

text: Good, hard working man. Does great work, and maintains good communication through the entire repair. Would recommend.

text: He is simply the best.

name: Gerald Duncan
text: The best Motorcycle Shop I have ever used. Gary is honest, trustworthy, professional, and will not replace anything that doesn't need to be replaced, unless you ask him, like I do. The Motorcycle dealerships will not work on any bike older than 10 years, and I have tried several Bike Shops but the people are lazy and have very poor work ethic. Do yourself a favor, use Tech46. Your life and your bike are worth it.

name: Ej Shelton
text: Very Professional Call On Tuesday They Told Me To Bring My Bike He Had It Done By Thursday And Suggested Other Repairs He Found While Repairing I Highly Recommend Tech46 I Wouldn’t Take My Bike Anywhere Else And Im A Hour Away

name: kristopher keith
text: I highly, highly,highly recommend this place!  I was on a 2600 mile road trip n my wheel bearing went out on my harley. They not only fit me in but had parts on hand and had back on the road In 2 hours! Can't enough good things about these great group of guys!

resp.text:
Thanks Mr Keith! We'll see ya down the road somewhere!!
Your team at TECH46

name: Jay Rock
text: Tech46 is a wonderful bike shop , the atmosphere is friendly and theirs plenty of bike memorabilia to keep you busy,  “Landers Sevier “ and I go back more than 24 years and I wouldn’t trust my bike with anyone else.

resp.text:
Jay Rock, my man! Thanks as always for being such a great ambassador for TECH46! Ya do know though that I retired from racing and the bike shop about 10 years ago (after 30 years in the biz)! Though I do hang out at the shop a lot trying to keep my heart and soul filled with all-things-bikes -- it's really Anthony and Dustin and the other fellas that make everything tick. They are the ones that "get it done". They are the driving force of what makes TECH46 such a successful shop. From drag race builds to general service and maintenance to roadrace to touring bikes and choppers - the TECH46 team led by Anthony and Dustin get the job done.
Keep rolling strong Jay Rock! See ya soon.

name: Higher Power
text: The best place to bring your motorcycle, if you are having any issues.

name: RO Lookup
text: I've used this shop for years. Landers and the crew down there are second to none. I've never had an issue they couldn't resolve. If you want it done right bring your bike here!!

name: mike bemis
text:
The mechanic here really took care of me.. I came in with my first wreck and insurance claim. He helped me figure out what actually needed to be repaired and what could’ve held off until I figured out a few financial things. They contacted the at-fault insurance company and got the approval, parts, and bike ready by the end of the following week. Will be coming back here. Highly recommended

P.S. - bike looks really good. Thank you.

resp.text:
Thanks Mike! We are always happy to help...and thanks for the kind words about your experience here at TECH46. Yes - we strive to provide the quickest turnaround possible, at a fair price without compromising the quality of work. Be safe out there!
See ya again soon!

name: Jack Sullivan
text: Tech 46 got my 82 Honda back on the road! Landers is a pro diagnosing accurately and quickly! Communication is stellar and pricing is as honest as it gets. I would absolutely recommend this shop to any riders in and around Birmingham!

resp.text: Thanks Jack for the compliments! All staff at TECH46 are consummate professionals in the motorcycle industry  - collectively they have about 150 years combined experience between them. While Landers does contribute to the shop at times, it is Anthony and Dustin who are the backbone of the operation and the main two guys who make the business successful. These are two of the best technicians in central Alabama. Every member of the TECH46 team, however works together to provide the best service, at the best price and it's always their aim to get the bikes in and out of the shop as quickly as possible so folks can ride and enjoy. See ya soon!

name: Lee Wellingham
text: Landers always goes out of his way to accommodate a customer. First rate service!

resp.text:
Mr Wellingham!
TECH46 thanks you greatly for the accolades!
Please note that while Landers does bring a certain of element of confidence to the customer base of TECH46...it is actually Anthony and Dustin and crew that are the foundation and backbone of the business. 90% of the daily activities of TECH46 and their business mantra of "get it done right" - "get it done quickly" - and "do it at a fair price" all belongs to Anthony and the boys in the trenches.
We all thank you for the kind words. (We live on 5 star reviews!) We'll see ya in the mountains soon I hope...Shredding!!

name: Dom NA
text: Took my BMW s1000rr in for service, and they was able to get my bike up, and running a lot faster then the other shops turn around time.

name: LuckyAF FPV
text: Used this shop many times over the years. . Even before the new location. Cost a lil more but always great service.

name: David Cataldo
text: Surprised to find this motorcycle shop so close to my office so I brought it in for a tire on my cruiser. Effortless transaction and top-notch work! They listened to my concerns and even explained to me the origin of a brake lever issue that I misguided myself about. Lander and Anthony didn't hesitate to insure I had the knowledge to make a good decision. I'll be using Tech46 from here on out!

name: akash bheemavarapu
text: I had air leaking out on my suziki DR650 and I took my motorcycle to this shop. They ordered a new tire and gave the bike back to me within a day which I felt is really professional.Other mechanic shops wont give it back so quick.Also, the owner seems really friendly and listens to whatever questions you have.

name: james christie
text: Awsome people. Will Ship my bike three states away to have work done.

name: Louis Gobeo
text: Outstanding shop. They're efficient, knowledgeable, and exacting. The atmosphere of the shop is great and so is their work. Tech46 has my highest recommendation.

name: connor blaschak
text: Very nice and fair guys. Had a pesky oil leak on my  2010 Triumph Bonneville and they fixed her right up very quickly at a fair price. Extremely pleasant people to deal who really seem to care about the condition of your bike instead of just caring about profit. If you are in Birmingham area and own a motorcycle I would definitely give them a call for any maintenance needed. I will surely be a returning customer. 5 stars earned.

resp.text: Hi Conner! We hope all is well with you! Thanks for giving TECH46 a thumbs up. It is greatly appreciated. We love triumphs - both vintage Triumphs and modern Triumphs -  here at TECH46! See ya again soon!

name: Joshua Moody
text: These guys are the best. Quick efficient and and know what they’re talking about. Very reliable. And their new location is awesome.

name: Johnny O
text: The guys at Tech46 are great!  They thoroughly know bikes, offer fast service and are  a pleasur to do business with.  Thank you Tech46.

name: Firas Nasr
text: Landers and his team did great professional job on my 09 CBR 1000RR and their costs are fair and equals the great quality job they do. Definitely recommend them and will always deal with them (HONEST PPL).

resp.text: Thanks Firas!! Very much appreciated! TECH46 will always do our best for you and all of our customers. While Landers does bring an element of motorcycle knowledge to the shop (when he is there), it is actually the tech's in the workshop and Anthony (the principal owner) who truly drive the ship and execute the work. Their work ethos is simple - provide top notch work...provide good communication - keep the folks bikes out on the road and not in the shop - do all this at a reasonable price.  If we can help ya in the future - we are here. See ya soon! T46

name: Matt Robbins
text: Great knowledgeable shop.

name: Kevin Coleman

name: Lawrence Krantz
text: On July 03, 2019 at about 1:50 pm. I was traveling back to south Mississippi on my motorcycle when I experienced a rear flat tire. I searched google for motorcycle repair shop in my area and tech46 appeared in search results. I contacted roadside assistance and requested to be brought to tech46. I waited for over 2 hours for someone from roadside assistance to come and tow me to tech46 for a tire repair, but could not get anyone to take my request. I contacted tech46 and spoke with Mr. Landers who stated that he was short handed due to the approaching holiday (July 4th) but would try and get someone to come and tow me in so I would not be stranded on the side of the road. After about 10 minutes, Mr. Landers telephoned me back stating he was on the way to pick me and my bike up and take it back to his shop and get me back on the road. Mr. Landers did exactly that, he arrived at my location with a trailer, loaded my motorcycle and brought it to his shop, Landers and his employees, Anthony and Dustin immediately began working on my motorcycle and had it repaired and returned to me fast, about 45 minutes. Landers, Anthony and Dustin were very courteous, professional and caring about making sure I was back on the road headed home, even though they were trying to close the business for the day. I would definitely recommend anyone who is in the Birmingham, Alabama area needing motorcycle repair, to look up tech46 for all your motorcycle repair needs.

resp.text:
We at TECH46 have traveled the globe over the past 4 decades on motorcycles - and i promise we have met many many difficulties along the way, and often times at the most inopportune times....but on every occasion total strangers have always pitched in to keep us moving no matter how difficult the obstacle! So of course we will pay it back to those like yourself who found a moment of difficulty on your own journey. We were happy to get you back on the slab! Thanks for letting us help!
Also - the fellas at TECH46 work as TEAMMATES and not so much as "employees". Each of us play an important and key role in the success of our shop - more akin to how a Championship winning NBA team functions. There is no heirarchy at TECH46. (But Anthony would be considered our coach!)
Have fun! Ride safe! We'll see ya down the road brother!

name: Maria McSherry
text:
The sales experience was great! No complaints.

My garage kept, babied ATV with less than 22 hours on it started experiencing issues in May 2020. After researching the issue in case it was a simple fix, I requested a service appointment, and after several days I finally received a call stating they were behind. Fast forward to now almost 2.5 months later and every time I call to schedule the service, I’m told is that service department is behind, and they’ll get to me. That is too long for a service appointment. It makes me question how good the products really are...What good is the extended warranty if you can’t use it? My ATV is basically new and I can’t ride it. I will never purchase a Polaris product again.

resp.text: Sorry for the unusual experience.  We understand the frustrations of vehicle down-time, and work hard to shorten the time it takes to get your vehicle repaired when it does have issues.  We did have you scheduled for an appointment to bring your vehicle to us on May 18th and when you did not show we attempted to contact you to reschedule.  Since we did not hear from you we assumed the issues with your ATV were no longer a problem.  If your ATV still needs service, please contact us and we will be happy to get you back on the schedule for the next available appointment.

name: Angie Porterfield
text:
If you are looking for an off road vehicle (atv, side by side) this is the first place to look. There was no pressure to buy today. Only the desire to listen so that could find the right machine for our needs and not the most expensive thing on the lot. Our salesman Spencer and the rest of the knowledgeable staff was able to answer every question that we had. The Staff also treated my wife with the respect that lacks in other dealer experiences . We left that day feeling like we have gotten a great deal and amazed at how friendly and respectful the staff is. We cannot say enough great things about the buying experience through Champion Powersports. The parts department has also been very knowledgeable and courteous while helping with parts and accessories for our ATV. The Polaris 570 utility edition that we purchased could not have been a better choice for our needs. This ATV has no trouble pulling the 950 pound trail mower we use on the farm or putting that smile on your face at the end of a hard days work . The 570 has more than enough power for the tough jobs or excitement out on the trail. The best way to describe the Polaris 570 utility edition and Champion Powersports is simple. The right tool for the job. Thank you to everyone at Champion for what you do.
Matthew Porterfield

text:
Robert and Brink are my go-to guys. Even though, Xtreme Offroad Ind. LLC (me) and Champion Powersports are competitors in our profession, every time I need to refill my supply shelf with Polaris specific maintenance items, or need to order specialty parts, I go see them. Usually you'll never hear of another powersport repair shop praising competition, but again these guys help me when I need it most.

I sometimes order parts that are on back-order or out-of-stock, but Jeff and the parts guys can usually get me fixed up somehow by working some magic! I ordered a crankshaft that was 3 months out on back-order and somehow they got it in 2 weeks. That is true customer service!

Again, Jeff, Robert, Brink, I appreciate you guys and whenever I need more Polaris supplies you'll be where I go first!

name: Karl Hofammann
text:
I have been doing business with Powersports Service Center for well over 5 years now. I currently own a 1995 Kawasaki Bayou 300 and a 2001 Suzuki King Quad 300. Prior to having my ATVs serviced at Powersports, other local shops would either: not service attempt to service my bikes due to their age or would not put out quality work. I decided to give this shop a try and many years later my two ATVs still run like a top. The pricing is fair and honest, the quality of the work is excellent and the turn around time is quick. Thank you Chris and Powersports for your kindness and all that you have done for my four-wheelers.
-Karl

resp.text: Thank you very much!

text: I brought my atv in for repair and recieved a 218.00 bill just to look at it and tell me it could not be repaired. Beware I got taken advantage of.

resp.text: I’m sorry you feel that way, but we are a business and our technicians do not work for free. We provide a complete and thorough assessment of our customers machines and sometimes it takes longer than 1 hr to do that.  Your ATV had multiple electrical issues that had to be sorted out before any estimate or evaluation could be done, which took several hours. The repair order you signed at drop off has our estimate fees clearly explained.

name: Michael Snowden
text: What a refreshing  experience I had at Powersports Service Center. I had a horrible experience down the street at a large dealer who kept my Honda Rancher for two months the first time to replace the carburetor and flush the fuel tank. After I finally picked it up I took off to Ohio on a week long hunting trip only to have it ruined by a carburetor that wasn’t installed properly. Matter of fact the 4 bolts that attach the carburetor were barely  finger tight causing fuel to leak into my air filter chamber. I came home and took it back for another 6 to 8 weeks and had to go sit in the waiting room to have someone actually work on my unit.   A week later after finally picking up my Rancher it wouldn’t crank. A friend told me about Powersports Service Center and  Chuck and the team were amazing. My unit was fixed in three days and the real problem was found and corrected immediately. My Rancher runs perfectly now cranking with the slightest touch of the starter. Powersports Service Center will be the only people who ever  work on my equipment from now on. Oh yeah, the price was very reasonable to top it off. Thank you Chuck!!!

resp.text: Thank you so much. Glad we could resolve your issue.

name: Jacob Bare
text: Dropped off a bike I got for my Nephew to have 2 tires put on the bike and was quoted $30 per tire. Went to pick it up and they said it was $178. They also charged me for 2 new tubes I didn’t need or ask for. I brought a new one in a box I already had that was purchased there. When I asked for a breakdown the owner became instantly rude and just out right nasty. “Don’t buy one if you can’t afford the maintenance”. Then the other worker went and got the tech and said come here this guy is complaining and then said he’d roll it in the back and take it off. That’s were I put my foot down. The tech was the only person in there with a level head about him. I tried taking it to Dothan Power Sports 1st but the we’re too busy to get it in and out today. No customer service skills whatsoever. I literally thought I was going to end up in the parking lot with the 2nd guy and I wasn’t even dealing with him. I definitely will not be back.

resp.text: We’re sorry that your experience didn’t go as expected. The $30 per tire was a labor only quote that was made clear at the time the unit was quoted. Customer requested two new tires and when the tech disassembled the bike, noticed it was missing key safety strips on the rim, one tube was deteriorated, and replaced out of safety concern and the longevity of the repair. The additional items and Alabama mandatory tire sales fee were the only charges the customer wasn’t aware of. The customer was phoned to be informed, but didn’t  answer the phone during the servicing, so that we could make him aware of the extra needed items.  When the customer arrived to pick up the unit, and was presented the repair bill, he was adamant that he wasn’t going to pay for the extra items, so it was offered to remove the items and return his original equipment.  In the end the shop owner marked down the cost of the repair and the shop gave the customer a free tube to help ease the cost of the repair. It was noted to the customer when he was there, that we can’t estimate all unforeseen things needed in a repair until the actual job was being performed.

text: I carried my Mule here to have a new battery installed , check voltage regulator, clean carb. Needle valve, just took off the float bowl didn't have to take off carb.  charges $20 for tiny needle valve. ($3  ) on internet. They said they cleaned out gas tank which they didn't, I've had to do it myself since I got it home. Won't ever take it back to them because they over charged me at $800 to do very little work and didn't do everything they said they did! Charge me 300% mark up on aftermarket parts. I was alarmed at the prices of parts and labor for such little work and then it not being done properly. Suggestion's, Make sure you get prices out front before they work on your bike!!!( The Mule work was in the name of Tim Hudson, check your work orders again! He Lives in Blakely Ga.)

resp.text:
Mr. Hutchins,
I reviewed our service repair tickets all the way back to June 2018, and we do not show ever working on a unit for you, listed as Jim Hutchins. Could you possibly be confusing our shop with Dothan Powersports(considering they sale and service Kawasaki product)?  If so, please kindly delete this unfavorable review of our facility, or inform us  to whom this unit was registered, for repair on the repair invoice, and date it entered the facility.
Thank you,
Jody Spann

name: Ted
text: Was quoted 6000 dollars on a  bike with an msrp rating of 4800. I recommend driving to Ozark to Beasleys Kawasaki. That is just outrageous. I was also quoted 5000 dollars on bikes that were between 3,500 - 4000 dollars most other places. I said I was a new rider, not an idiot.

resp.text: Mr. Conner. We never presumed you to be an idiot,  but you have to also understand business are different independent franchises.  Our prices at the time you visited this dealership reflected the total price out the door with all applicable state and local taxes and freight charges for the particular unit you were interested in. At this particular time we also has packaged prices for machines that included 5 years worth of warranty, jacket, helmet, and gloves. When you call different dealers in different areas they have the ability to quote you a machine at a lesser price and once your in the closing office they introduce the total price including the added fees. Something you overlook when ranting about our prices in this review, I'm sure.  The same goes for where you choose to purchase your auto, boat, or RV. Its called free enterprise and I hope you understand that ranting about it doesn't change what made this country great. Thank you!

text: Told me out would cost $300-400. Picked It up and it was $600. Now I'm selling my bike for parts. Go to Beasley's.

resp.text:
Greg,
Sorry this may have happened, unfortunately I don't have much in the way of information on your particular situation based on your unfavorable review.

As with an estimated guess,  looking at the crystal ball of problems, there is no way to accurately predict all situations, until the work is being performed. As well as, when a customer drops off a machine and doesn't complete reveal the entire back story. This may not be the case in this particular situation, but in many instances maintenance becomes a can of worms, and if the machine is to work properly (for which it was brought to the dealership) there are additional things to be performed. If those are not addressed, it can cause an unsafe machine and therefore cost yourself and the dealership more in the long run. We hope that you understand maintenance isn't an exact science.

Needless to say they probably saved my life phone had already shut off twice due to overheating on this 100 degree day. Repair was done quickly and would not have missed half a day of work, if I had just let them pick me up in the first place.  Highly recommend!!! text: Rod hooked me up today with a great tune for my 2012 Harley-Davidson V-Rod. I recently installed a new exhaust and ran a canned tune that came with with my Fuel Moto Micro EFI tuner. The air/fuel mix was too rich, power was lumpy, and throttle response had significant lag. I left the bike at Rod's for the day, and it is now running GREAT!!! I highly recommend this shop for your tuning needs.

name: X Smith
text: I called Rod's Performance on a Monday August 29, 2016 and explained that I had bought a Power Commander that needs to be installed on my Honda CB1000R and Rod said no problem. I called again on Tuesday to ask him how long it would take he said about 3 hours. He said he could do it on Friday. I said that would be great and how much? He told me 380.00. I knew from other shops that was High but I agreed to be there on Friday. I called a third time on Thursday to make sure Friday was still good as I had to take off work and it was a 2 hour drive for me. Rod said bring it on and he will take care of it. We got to Rods Performance around 8am Friday morning. I introduced my self but Rod just continued to eat his breakfast. Then his worker shows up and said what is that out side a Honda duki. Anyways when I approached Rod with the PC5 and the bike, he then tells me he did not plan to install the PC5 because that would take all day. He was just going to tune the bike for the sum of 380.00. I told home he was insane. He refused to do the work and I left for another 2 hour ride home. No apologies, very rude individual and unprofessional. I definitely would not recommend Rods Performance. Motorcycle Solutions in Montgomery put in the PC5 for 120.00 and Harley Davidson of Montgomery is going to put it on their DYNO and tune it. If I hadn't talked to Rod three different times I would have chalked this up to a misunderstanding but this is certainly not the case. The fact that he thought it was an all day project instead of the hour and 5 minutes that it took to put on, I would say he doesn't have a clue what he is talking about.

I  highly recommend Rod's to any one in his area or guys traveling  near his shop.

text: I am so happy I found this place. I purchased a Hammerhead 250ss go cart second hand and when I purchased it, it would turn over but not start. The owner said the he let the go cart sit up for a year, but it did run but was pretty sure the carburetor needed cleaning. I took it to Basch Brothers in Cullman, because this is where the cart was originally purchased. I told them that I wanted to get the carburetor cleaned  and to look over the go cart for anything else it needed. They called me the next day and said it had no compression. I told them that's odd because when I purchased the cart, I checked the compression and it was at 90lbs. They said I don't know what to tell you but we are only get 60lbs. AT this point I understood they didn't want to work on it and I picked it up and took it to Dr. Joe's in Ensley. They found the carburetor was gumed up and the vacuum line. They return the go cart to me  the next day completely fixed. The fee was only $115 and the work was completed quicker than I expected.

text: Whatever you do, DO NOT let them work on anything that you own.  I spent over $1,300.00 with them to repair my Honda four wheeler.  The say to only run marine gas in it.  They replaced the carburetor and put regular unleaded gas in it.  They charged me $3.50 for a gallon of gas.  More than marine gas would be.  They did not tell me this when I picked it up that they put regular gas in it.  It sat for four months with Covid-19 and work keeping me from using it.  Guess what?  The brand new carburetor now has to be serviced because of the gas they put in it.  They are more than happy to repair what THEY caused, for an additional $300.00.  These guys are crooks!  If I could give them negative stars, I would.

resp.text: There is no OEM warranty that covers gasoline solidification (which is caused by months of non-use). No machine can sit up for 4 months with any type of gas and not cause issues. It is your responsibility to either put stabilizer in fuel or periodically start up the machine.

text:
I purchased a 2021 Honda Pioneer 1000-3

Overhead gun rack

I just got back from having top and rear window installed. I took delivery of machine last Thursday as I wanted to use at huntn camp .
I want to give a shout out to all involved in the sales , parts and delivery of this machine.
Bob Smith is a great asset to the company. Andy was a huge help as he did a lot of the original deal workup.
Cindy in parts was fabulous in going over the various options that was aval . She really knows the parts and was a great help. Think you Cindy.
Jack in service was awsome. His knowledge of the Honda ATV and SXS is really amazing. He made sure I was comfortable with every aspect of the machine. I put 25 miles on it last weekend and was blown away by the power and operation of machine. It performed flawless.
Thanks to all it truley was a pleasure working with each of you.
I will definitely reccomend to anyone wanting to buy a ATV / UTV to give Halls a chance I don't think you'll be disappointed.
Ps
I bought a Honda Formen 4 wheeler 8 years ago Oct. 2012 The unit has only had one sparkplug  one battery and regular oil change at dealer. This was  the  reason I went back to Halls for this machine. The 4 wheeler has about 1600 miles on it .
Thanks
James Irby

text: Showed up expecting to buy a Honda 2200i generator for the advertised website price of $999 and was told that was for the 2018 model and the ones they carry are $1249. Waited around in the showroom for several minutes for an answer. Guess it's the customers fault they don't update inventory and prices. Would have made a purchase had they not been shady. Wilson Dismukes had the generator for $1049, so did Lowe's and Amazon. Hard to believe a certified Honda dealer can have their prices beat by every 3rd party dealer in town. Not my first bad experience here. Beware!!

name: Jack Redpath
text:
Over the years, I’ve owned every type of the “Big Four” - Honda, Yamaha, Suzuki, Kawasaki  -  motorcycles, ATVs, and UTVs .  When it comes to quality and reliability you can’t beat Honda!  I won’t buy anything else!

I’m all about customer service … so much so that I drive 6 hours out of my way to buy from Hall’s Motorsports in Mobile, AL.    Andy Stacy, the sales manager, and Bob Smith, the finance lead, have always treated me with courtesy, honesty, respect, and the best price.  As long as Andy and Bob are there, I’ll always buy from Hall’s.  If you’re looking for the best, give Andy a call. You won’t be sorry!

Jack O’Rourke
Panama City

text: Though we are satisfied with our bike purchase we are very unsatisfied with our visit for the "first service" today. When we purchased the bike we were asked if we wanted to purchase a "service plan" we asked did this include future oil changes, etc. We were told "yes". So we purchased the "service plan" for $799. We took the bike in today for the first service only to be told that this was actually an "extended warranty!" Although the buyers order CLEARLY READS it as a SERVICE CONTRACT! We would have not EVER purchased a new vehicle of any sort without a service contract. The buyers contract is very misleading and lead us to believe that we were indeed purchasing the service contract that we inquired about. Very disappointed!

I drove from Dothan,Al to buy this machine and thought I would be treated better than this. I really dont mind the fee but the so called cleaning that was done was absolutely ridiculous.  Not clean at all. I will never do business with them again.

text: False advertised prices, and rude sales staff.

name: Ace Cannon
text: Easily one of the best Motorsports shops I've ever been in. All the staff are awesome and fun. Really enjoyed it.

name: RB Nelson
text:
I took a dirt bike to the Government St location in Mobile AL for repairs and was told they would straighten the handlebars for $100. After pickup I was charged the $100 and told they don’t straighten handlebars! I called and the service manager was unwilling to either refund the $100 or straighten the handlebars. He even refused to admit they charged me for straightening the handlebars and read the receipt which said nothing about my handlebars. I know what I was told would be done when I was quoted a price, they ripped me off. I would HIGHLY recommend not doing business with these crooks!
Update: In response to the owner’s reply... Your service manager was unprofessional and argumentative, repeatedly talking over me during our short conversation. I asked to be transferred to “the owner” because I thought you’d actually listen to a customer’s complaint, but I was told you were not there and I quote your service manager “I am the only one you’re going to deal with”. Sadly he was right because I still haven’t received a phone call from you to hear my side of the story.
I’ve heard stories about how you treat your customers. I’m just glad I learned my lesson on a dirt bike repair, not a purchase. Fortunately was only overcharged $100 but that’s enough to lose my business and spread the word for others to go elsewhere.
Don’t just take my word for it Mobile, I suggest you ask around before you do business with Hall's.

resp.text: We regret this customer feels this way about his service experience.  It is our company policy to not straighten handlebars if they are bent due to the structural damage that has been caused, for the safety of our customers.  Safety is our utmost priority and we were upfront that we cannot straighten/bend damaged handlebars.   We suggested to replace the handlebars, which was declined by the customer.  The only charges, stated in the customer's receipt, was for the replacement of front tire, oil change, and safety inspection.  We offered to repair the customer's damaged forks, triple clamps, and handlebars and unfortunately, those repairs were declined.

name: Dare Devil Diablo
text:
(Edited 4/30/19)

I bought a new $12,000 bike from Mobile Halls Honda in 2016.  This was my second brand new $10,000+ Honda.  I recently purchased a $10,000+ KTM elsewhere (Not from Halls) because I could not get this dealer to work with me.

First Red Flag, the bike had 14 miles on it at delivery.  I guess someone took it home for the night...  (They did disclose the mileage at the time of sale.)

Later, I had some issues and wanted the bike looked at under warranty.  I was told they would charge me to look at it if they could not submit a warranty claim to Honda.  This is lack of basic customer service.  If you want your customers to come back you take care of them.  Take care of your customer and they will take care of you.

Later still, I wanted to trade in my paid off bike that I purchased from them for a new one.  They told me if I wanted to trade in that they would "give me a good price" for my bike because I bought it from them and I'm buying another.  Great!!!, or so I thought...  They offered me about 80% of my motorcycles KBB Trade in Value.  80% of Trade In!!!  My bike is in like new condition, air conditioned garage kept!!

So long story short, I guess I am done with Mobile Honda.  I guess I wont rule out Halls in general...  Its kind of tough with them being the only game in town.

resp.text:
As the owner of Hall’s Motorsports, I take this comment very seriously.  We have many talented women in our organization and I value their contributions to our success greatly. Women hold the highest positions in our organization and will continue to do so.

We have no record of a Margie Rathers working for us, but I am sorry she feels the way she does. I am available for a discussion on these and any other matters where our employees or customers feel diminished in any way.

Trent Hall
www.visithalls.com

The parts guy took the time to research and found two sets of pads in stock for me to choose from.....  and at a great price. I was very impressed.

Based on this I would not hesitate to recommend Halls Honda for parts. This was a pleasant and surprising experience, I will be back. Thanks Halls.

name: Ropa Vieja
text:
After spending a considerable amount of time shopping for a bike at various dealers I wanted to give a more concise review of my experience with this dealership.  My original review was a bit critical, due primarily to my lack of experience working with dealers when buying a new bike.   Let me elaborate:
Dealership:  Original review was that this was a typical Harley Dealership,  however after visiting a few others out of the area, I would say it is above average.  Welcoming staff with good selection of bikes and gear, an overall comfortable environment to shop.
Finance:  They definitely did not mess around with offering a solid interest rate out of the gate.  The finance person was great, explained all the numbers and answered all my questions.  The application process was easy and overall enjoyable.
Pricing:  Spot on pricing with MSRP.  Standard doc, destination fees, however there wasn’t an additional mark up on the price.
Sales:  This is where the deal fell apart. Another dealer offered to include the new riders course ($250) and deliver the bike for free ( a little over 50 miles ).  Being my local Harley dealer and a member of the same owners group,  I thought this might be standard among the three shops. It was not.   When I asked if they would do the same, the answer was “no”.  Asked if that was a deal breaker, I replied yes and that was the end of that until I posted my review here online.
A different sales person contacted me and tried to make the deal, unfortunately I was still annoyed and never really gave him a chance to try to work it out.
Overall, I have no reservations giving this dealer a 5 star review after shopping around, the majority of the process was smooth and enjoyable.  After all is said and done would I go back and try again, absolutely.

resp.text: Very sorry to hear this, Ropa.  Please give our GM, Mike DeSantis, a call at 205-560-1234.  He'll make sure you are taken care of.

name: Charles Franklin
text: I went in to buy myself, my wife, and daughter all new shirts 2 different men asked me how I was doing, NOONE asked "may I help you" I get up to the cash register to pay $102 for my shirts, I told the lady I was from Poplar Bluff MO and just drove 6 1/2 hours to get here, didn't interest her, told her I was just on a poker run in Illinois last Saturday with 200 bikes, didn't interest her, what did interest her was when I asked could I pay for it with rolled up coins, she was all happy to accept this till my daughter brought the money in, she then proceeded to tell me it would take about another 30-45 minutes cause she has to open every roll of coins, and count them, I asked her why do this just pick out 1-2 of them open them and count those, she informed me that if it was short just 1 coin, it would come out of her pocket, so I threw $3 on top of the change and said "here this should cover the missed coin so instead of paying $101 and some change for 3 shirts, I ended up paying $102 in rolled change plus 3- $1 bills so $105 for 3 shirts and she didn't even give me my change. I'm going everywhere I know (Facebook,media, newspapers,etc.) Telling my story "DO NOT SHOP HEART OF DIXIE HARLEY DAVIDSON IN PELHAM ALABAMA!!!!! )

name: Bob Kuehner
text:
UPDATE on 10/20/2015... The GM reached out to me quickly and decisively and solved my most recent problem.  I was really impressed with what he said about his commitment to making the quality of service at Heart of Dixie as great as the quality of shopping and sales.

ORIGINAL POST on 10/15/2015... Loved the "bike purchase" part--5 stars.  Bought a brand new Vrod Muscle in 2011 and a new Road Glide Ultra in 2012.  Unfortunately, like so many other businesses out there, once you buy they forget all about you.  I'm speaking specifically about service--1 star.  The quality of service is fine--4 star, but the speed of service is what kills the rating for me--1 star.  Waiting two weeks on a regular basis to get your bike back is crazy.  That's been my experience on multiple occasions.  Counting today, five times, I've discovered problems as I'm about to go out of town on a ride.  They've been completely unwilling to work me in and help out so that I could make my trips.  Today was a little different.  I tried to get through to service and left messages beginning a 4 pm and now they've closed and still no call back.  I've had much better luck on service with Rider's Harley Davidson in Trussville.  Interesting to me that both stores are owned by the same man.  I've heard it said that the easiest customer to get is the one you already have.  In this particular case, I'll have to decide if the "joy" of owning a Harley is worth the aggravation of getting it taken care of!

resp.text: Hi Bob, We're very happy that we were able to get this fixed for you.  We greatly appreciate your business and strive to make your Harley-Davidson experience here at Heart of Dixie top notch.  Please don't hesitate to reach out to us in the future as we're always here to help.  Thanks again and we look forward to working with you again soon!

name: larry Hatchett
text: Well once again I take my bike in for issue I couldn't find out what it was asked a friend he said could be rear bearings or neck bearings unload go in talk with guy at counter( problem, bike has a roar and vibration at 20 to 40 mph when leaning toward the left can tell sound is coming from rear has a wobble at 70 + mph to the left ) so we walk outside I explained problems and my concern about bearings was told I needed to buy a rear tire [not covered in warranty] [bike has 4500 miles] because it was cupped on left side because I was making to many lefthand turns I asked if they could be a problem with bike causing the cupping told no is was how I was riding  so I asked if I purchased rear tire and the vibration is still in bike do I have to still pay for rear tire when it was not the problem was told yes I do was also told the neck bearings wasn't covered in warranty understand this all come from just walking outside NO TEST RIDE nothing but conversation about how I need to buy stuff before they even check the bike out seams like all this service department is about is selling parts to find out problems instead of having good techs to find problems for customers just because we buy 20,30,40 thousand dollar bikes don't mean we want to spend hundreds more on hunches of what might be a problem.

resp.text: Hey Larry, I understand your frustation and I'm very sorry to hear this.  I will have this reviewed by our GM and will make sure this is taken care of for you.  Please let us know the best way to get in touch with you so we can get this fixed.

text: Very poorly run. Lost parts off my 4 wheeler. Would not answer my calls and even began to pick up and hang up rather than give me updates. Picked up my 4 wheeler after 4-5 weeks and it had not been repaired. Had to wait almost 2 hours for them to halfway put it back together so I could pick it up. Missing lots of bolts, screws and gear shifter knob. 😞 carburetor was dripping gas.

name: Bobby Wayne
text:
Such contradictory comments.
I am looking for a place to go to now that I have another bike.  Guess I'll just see for myself.  Hopefully since previous owner is not there.  But want to be able to leave my bike and trust no one will do anything shady.  Been down that road! Although my bike didn't cost 10grand ,to me it did.Barely worth 5grand its mine ,pretty and Paid for. Thanks for letting me post and I'll see how it goes

name: Odell Sanders
text: Not recommended. Unprofessional staff. Mechanics make too many excuses. Business phones don't work or aren't answered. No way to call them and they won't call you to provide updates on your equipment. That was the case for me. Disorganized shop and showroom with parts, tools, other debris scattered around. Smoking is allowed inside the building. They had my motorcycle +3 months, didn't do anything. I paid just to retrieve my bike. Other customers I encountered were so angry/ upset at poor service, I knew I had to get my bike ASAP. I figured they probably won't be in business long if they didn't improve service. Didn't want to get a lawyer and have to go to court to retrieve my bike after their closure or bankruptcy.

name: Greg Coleman
text: Website says they are open at 8am and they don't open til 9am. No one answers the phone when you call. Goes to fax machine. Arrived at place again at 10:23 and nobody was there. Waited 45 mins with several other customers and they never showed back up. Recommend if you own a company and post the store hours you should be there. Don't shop at this place!!!

name: James Gatlin
text:
I brought in two motorcycles, one had a good motor and the other a blowed motor. I asked that he put the good motor on the good bike. We had a gentleman's agreement that I would pay more than a thousand dollars, and that would include two new tires. After looking closer at the tires I had I found that I had two good tires between the two bikes. I tried calling to check on the progress on my bike, but wasn't able to speak with anyone. Phill, the owner tells me, when I went in to check on my bike, that they got trash in my carbs. He had the carbs off my bike and was supposedly cleaning them. When he called me and told me my bike was ready I picked it up and only two cylinders was firing, the clutch was slipping, and the carbs were pouring gas. I took it back  the same day under the 30 day warranty to have it properly fixed. When he called me that my bike was ready and I went to pick it up he tries to charge me another $350.00. I called the police out to try and get my bike, but they said they couldn't get invovled and I would have to pay the money or get an attorney. I didn't trust him to leave my bike any longer, so paid the money to get my bike. My bike is sitting in my yard with the carbs still flooding out. After more than $1,400 dollars spent and I still can't drive my bike. If you value your property, do not take it to Prattville power sports. I'm getting an attorney and going to court.

Today June 4, 2019, I had the pleasure of meeting the new owners of Prattville power sports. I had bought a new battery from phill when he done the work on my bike. Today I found out that the battery he put in my bike wasn't the same battery he said he put in. That it was a cheaper version, but he charges me for the more expensive battery. The new owner pulled out the old bills and showed me the difference and then gave me the battery that I was suppose to have from the beginning. I now believe and tmhave complete trust in the new owners and plan to do my business with them now that I know phill is gone. Thank you Prattville power sports.

name: David Bartlett
text:
I just relocated to Alabama from Texas when I contacted, Ronnie.  I had been having problems with finding someone to work on my bike.  I have a ’95 Honda VT1100c Shadow.  No one wanted to work on it because of it’s age & my regular mechanic had closed up shop.  When I spoke to, Ronnie I explained what I wanted him to do.  I asked him how long would it take to complete the job.  He told him that it would be two weeks.  I agreed to that.  He came out to my house in late July to pick up my bike & take it to his shop.
I waited the two weeks & gave him al call.  He said that he was still working on another bike & he was waiting for parts to come in.  I said, that was fine, I can wait for a few more weeks.  Two more weeks came about & he still hasn’t gotten to it.  So, I just gave up & bought another bike in September.  I finally got a call from him on October 10th & 12:38 pm.  He said that he got it done.  I called him back & asked him how much it was, he said the total was $865.44.   I told him I would have to pick it up in a month. He agreed.  When I got there on November the 23rd to pick it up, he had flattened the rear tire.  He said  he broke the valve stem.  He told me he was going to charge me $75.00 to replace the stem that he broke.  I then asked him if we could start it, he said again, no.  The bike did have to be bottle fed.  So, I took it home.  When I got home I bottle fed it, it wouldn’t start.  I called him & he said that it ran when he had it.  So, I asked him if he could look at it & see if he could figure out what was wrong.  He said that it would be two weeks & he would get $80.00 an hour to fix it.  Keep in mind, I just gave him the previous day, $865.00 in cash.  So, I took the carbs back off.  The only thing he changed was the diaphragms. The main jets, slow jets all were corroded & stopped up. He had the float heights all off.  He even used rubber hose for fuel line.  I called him back to ask for half a refund on it. I called him out on what he did.  When I told him that the jets were filthy & the carb bodies were filthy he stuttered & then told me that I am not getting sh*t back and hung up.  I wouldn’t let this man work on anything.  The review on here before mine had a bad experience & they were there when I picked up my bike.  If I could give it negative starts if I could. These pictures below show what I got for my money. You can see that the bottom of the carbs are green & the jets are old & stopped up.

name: Vickie Thrower-Mills
text:
We took our 2001 Indian Chief that had been setting up for 7 years to this shop.  Big Mistake.  He charged us $3500 plus to fix it.  He was clearly aware that it had set up.  The first time we went to get it, It would not start and the lights wouldn't work.  He ask how long has this gas been in here. My husband said 7 years remember you were supposed to drain the tank for me.  He even wrote it sat up for 7 years on the receipt.  He painted the front  fender with paint that didn't match.  He put a used rear tire on it and called it a new one.  It had dirt and clay mud on it and the bike wouldn't start so where would the mud come from on a new tire? .  We left it with him for obvious reasons.  My husband ask him to replace the bushing in the handle bars since we were leaving it anyway.We paid him in the beginning to change the light covers.  He charged us twice the original one he ordered we found in the saddle bags.    My husband starts home on it today.  The brake light would not go off and the mirror was just spinning. You would think he would have saw that when replacing the bushing in the handlebars. My husband gets to Arab while driving the brand new war bonnet on the fender fell off.  Oil is leaking from a bike that he supposedly changed the oil and fixed the clutch on it.  We paid this man 3700 plus and he didn't take enough pride in his work to even wipe the dust off the bike.  I was using his shop rag to do that while we were waiting to get it running last week.  He literally took it out of my hand.  When I first met him i told my husband he seems like a good Christian person.  Boy was I wrong he might be a Christian.  I have no Idea but good is far from the truth.  We are very upset with the way we were ripped off.
We took our bike to another shop because it was obvious that Ronnie did not change the tires, the battery, fix the carburetor or anything we ask him and paid him to do. They could not believe that anyone would say the changed tires when they were literally rotten around the rim because it had set up for 7 years. He really screwed us out of 3700.00 He is a dishonest man. The Battery was 7 years old yet he said it was new. Along with the tires.
